title: How to Make a Single Serve Pie in the Microwave

steps.headline: Crush the graham crackers.
steps.description: Start by putting 1 or 2 graham crackers into a plastic bag and crushing them with your hands until they are crumbs, but don't make it too fine. Get out the container that you will be making your apple pie in. This can be a ramekin, bowl, or a mug. Make sure the container isn't too small! At a minimum, it should be able to hold 1 diced apple.

steps.headline: Melt the butter, then mix it with the crumbs.
steps.description: Put 1 tablespoon of butter into your container and melt it in the microwave for approximately 15 seconds. Add your bag of graham cracker crumbs into the butter and mash it down with your fingers. If you would like, try to push the crumbs up the sides of the container if you want it to be more like a real pie.

steps.headline: Core, peel, and cut up 1 green apple.
steps.description: Make sure that you cut it up into pretty small chunks, not into slices. Put the apple in a separate microwave-safe bowl or measuring cup.

steps.headline: Combine the apple with the remaining ingredients.
steps.description:
Add these ingredients into your apple chunks and stir to coat the apple. 1 tablespoon flour
1 teaspoon powdered sugar
1/2 teaspoon apple pie spice
Juice from 1/4 of a lemon

steps.headline: Put the mixture into the microwave for approximately 2 minutes.
steps.description: The apples should be soft and juices should be extracted.

steps.headline: Pour the apples into the crust.
steps.description:
Pour the apple mixture into the crust of your pie. If desired, top your mini-pie with ice cream. Nutrition facts
90 kcal per serving
50mg sodium
4g fat
Less than 1g protein
13g carbs
1g fiber

steps.headline: Prepare the crust.
steps.description: Start by putting 2 graham crackers into a plastic bag and crushing them into crumbs with your hands. Make sure you don't make it too fine! Press it into the bottom of whatever container you are using, like a microwave-safe ramekin, mug, or bowl. Try to choose a dish that holds at least 8 to 12 fl oz (237 to 355 mL).

steps.headline: Mix the pumpkin pie filling.
steps.description:
In a separate small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients and stir until no lumps remain:
1/3 cup pumpkin puree
1 egg
1 tablespoon milk
2 tablespoons brown sugar
1 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice
1 pinch of salt
1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract

steps.headline: Microwave the pie.
steps.description: Pour your pumpkin mixture on top of the crust and smooth it over with a spoon. Microwave for 1-1/2 to 2 minutes, checking on it every 30 seconds, until it starts to look solid. The top may still look damp when you take it out, but it will set more as it cools.

steps.headline: Let it cool for 3-5 minutes to let the pie fully set.
steps.description:
Top with whipped cream if you would like. Nutrition facts
260 kcal per serving
1130mg sodium
8g fat
9g protein
37g carbs
3g fiber

text:
Microwaving Single Serve Apple Pie Crush the graham crackers. Start by putting 1 or 2 graham crackers into a plastic bag and crushing them with your hands until they are crumbs, but don't make it too fine. Get out the container that you will be making your apple pie in. This can be a ramekin, bowl, or a mug. Make sure the container isn't too small! At a minimum, it should be able to hold 1 diced apple. Melt the butter, then mix it with the crumbs. Put 1 tablespoon of butter into your container and melt it in the microwave for approximately 15 seconds. Add your bag of graham cracker crumbs into the butter and mash it down with your fingers. If you would like, try to push the crumbs up the sides of the container if you want it to be more like a real pie. Core, peel, and cut up 1 green apple. Make sure that you cut it up into pretty small chunks, not into slices. Put the apple in a separate microwave-safe bowl or measuring cup. Combine the apple with the remaining ingredients. Add these ingredients into your apple chunks and stir to coat the apple. 1 tablespoon flour
1 teaspoon powdered sugar
1/2 teaspoon apple pie spice
Juice from 1/4 of a lemon Put the mixture into the microwave for approximately 2 minutes. The apples should be soft and juices should be extracted. Pour the apples into the crust. Pour the apple mixture into the crust of your pie. If desired, top your mini-pie with ice cream. Nutrition facts
90 kcal per serving
50mg sodium
4g fat
Less than 1g protein
13g carbs
1g fiber Microwaving Single Serve Pumpkin Pie Prepare the crust. Start by putting 2 graham crackers into a plastic bag and crushing them into crumbs with your hands. Make sure you don't make it too fine! Press it into the bottom of whatever container you are using, like a microwave-safe ramekin, mug, or bowl. Try to choose a dish that holds at least 8 to 12 fl oz (237 to 355 mL). Mix the pumpkin pie filling. In a separate small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients and stir until no lumps remain:
1/3 cup pumpkin puree
1 egg
1 tablespoon milk
2 tablespoons brown sugar
1 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice
1 pinch of salt
1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract Microwave the pie. Pour your pumpkin mixture on top of the crust and smooth it over with a spoon. Microwave for 1-1/2 to 2 minutes, checking on it every 30 seconds, until it starts to look solid. The top may still look damp when you take it out, but it will set more as it cools. Let it cool for 3-5 minutes to let the pie fully set. Top with whipped cream if you would like. Nutrition facts
260 kcal per serving
1130mg sodium
8g fat
9g protein
37g carbs
3g fiber
